Author: ashwin#5867
Content: I've been having some trouble building and running Komodod on Mac. The build-mac.sh file in the zcultils directory only recognizes gcc@6. I had gcc@7 and it did not recognize the compiler. If that is a bug, I can fix the build-mac.sh to recognize version >= gcc6 on Mac.

Author: ashwin#5867
Content:
Running zcutils/fetch-params.sh gives the following errors `./zcutil/fetch-params.sh: line 112: flock: command not found
Only one instance of fetch-params.sh can be run at a time.`

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Thanks for the feedback , haven't tried gcc7 will test this and let you know from our side

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @ashwin  Currently we have seen that gcc6 is working with no issues , this is why still is the version that is in the guide , unless we see that it presents an issue there's no i need to change it.

Author: ashwin#5867

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: Does it read the publickey from the given file?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need a valid pubkey in the -pubkey= parameter

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: use validateaddress <taddr>

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the "pubkey" field starts with 02 or 03, 66 chars for a 33 byte secp256k1 compressed pubkey

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: can i create a wallet in cli?

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: What is a z address?

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: komodo is a fork of Zcash and Zcash has two kinds of address: a z-addr is a fully private address that uses the zero-knowledge proving system to shield a transaction and balance privacy. A t-addr (aka "transparent address") is similar to a Bitcoin address.

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: Ok. How do i create a wallet so that I have an address?

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: Should I get a zcash address and  validate it with komodo-cli?
